head.title: Seeing Patriotism In a Fresh Light

hedline.hl1: Seeing Patriotism In a Fresh Light

abstract.p: Prof Howard L Reiter letter notes 19th-century reformer Carl Schurz's comments on patriotism (July 1 article)

block.p: Victor Navasky (''Debating How Best to Love Your Country,'' Arts & Ideas pages, July 1) and David M. Victor Navasky (''Debating How Best to Love Your Country,'' Arts & Ideas pages, July 1) and David M. Kennedy (''The Truest Measure of Patriotism,'' Op-Ed, July 4) both cited Stephen Decatur's famous quotation ''Our country! . . . may she always be in the right; but our country, right or wrong'' (1816).
To me, the best comment on patriotism is that of the 19th-century reformer Carl Schurz:
''Our country, right or wrong. When right, to be kept right; when wrong, to be put right'' (1899).
HOWARD L. REITER Coventry, Conn., July 4, 2000
The writer is a professor of political science, University of Connecticut at Storrs.
